lgp.core.evolution.fitness

Class FitnessFunction<TData,TOutput extends Output<TData>>

  • lgp.core.evolution.fitness.FitnessFunction<TData,TOutput>

  • public class FitnessFunction<TData,TOutput extends Output<TData>>

    Provides the functionality to compute the fitness of an individual program on a set of input-output examples.

    The fitness value should always be a simple double but the way in which the value is determined can be customised depending on the type of program/fitness cases.

    A fitness function is really just a function that maps a set of program outputs with a set of examples in some way. It is encapsulated in a class to make the interaction with it slightly nicer and more straightforward (especially when used from Java).

    An implementation of the class can be directly queried for fitness using the () operator.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FitnessFunction()
      Provides the functionality to compute the fitness of an individual program on a set of input-output examples.

      double invoke(java.util.List<? extends TOutput> outputs, java.util.List<? extends lgp.core.evolution.fitness.FitnessCase<? extends TData>> cases)
      Allows FitnessFunction.fitness to be called directly using () syntax (e.g. fitnessFunctionInstance(outputs, cases)).

    • Constructor Detail

      • FitnessFunction

        public FitnessFunction()

        Provides the functionality to compute the fitness of an individual program on a set of input-output examples.

        The fitness value should always be a simple double but the way in which the value is determined can be customised depending on the type of program/fitness cases.

        A fitness function is really just a function that maps a set of program outputs with a set of examples in some way. It is encapsulated in a class to make the interaction with it slightly nicer and more straightforward (especially when used from Java).

        An implementation of the class can be directly queried for fitness using the () operator.

    • Method Detail

      • fitness

        public double fitness(java.util.List<? extends TOutput> outputs,
                      java.util.List<? extends lgp.core.evolution.fitness.FitnessCase<? extends TData>> cases)

        Computes the fitness based on the given outputs and cases.

        Parameters:
        outputs - A set of predicted program outputs.
        cases - A set of expected outputs.
        Returns:
        A double value that represents the error measure between the predicted/expected outputs.

      • invoke

        public double invoke(java.util.List<? extends TOutput> outputs,
                     java.util.List<? extends lgp.core.evolution.fitness.FitnessCase<? extends TData>> cases)

        Allows FitnessFunction.fitness to be called directly using () syntax (e.g. fitnessFunctionInstance(outputs, cases)).

        See Also:
        FitnessFunction.fitness
